page.title: 07Transport and communications
page.content: The main through road in the area is the A12. The A12 is a major dual carriageway trunk route and in the area consists of two or three lanes in each direction. The A12 by-passes Ingatestone which was formerly a bottleneck on the old A12. Along Ingatestone High Street there is frequent evidence of its importance in previous times with a number of old courtyards which contained stables in the days of horse-drawn transport. The narrow High Street may sometimes revert to carrying the traffic of the A12 when there are road works or when the main road is closed due to an accident - when this happens there is considerable congestion. The other roads in the area are unclassified and take mainly local traffic.
